column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Be Happy With Your Car
#Text=Being content and thankful for what you have is a good way to stay positive .
#Text=Unfortunately , not all people can afford a brand new , flashy , sporty car with all the latest gadgets .
#Text=It is n't always easy to be content with your humble or merely average car .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Think about what your car does for you .
#Text=Does it get you to work , school , and other events on time ?
#Text=Be glad that you have a car .
#Text=Back when there were no cars , you would have had to travel by on foot or by horse .
#Text=Some people cannot afford a car at all .
#Text=Look at your car 's exterior .
#Text=Do the doors open and lock properly ?
#Text=Does the car have all four wheels ?
#Text=Learn to accept the way your car looks on the outside .
#Text=Do n't be too concerned about what others think of the car .
#Text=Chances are you do n't know them , so they probably do n't really care .
#Text=Now , look at the interior .
#Text=Do the windows open ?
#Text=Does the car have air conditioning and/or heating ?
#Text=What about the radio ?
#Text=Think of all the positives about your car .
#Text=Think about what having a fancy , fast , sporty , or exotic car would do for you .
#Text=People wo n't like you for your car .
#Text=In fact , instead of admiring your car , it would probably just make them jealous .
#Text=What good would that do ?
#Text=Think about the downsides of owning a nice car .
#Text=If you got a dent or a burn hole , it would be a big deal .
#Text=With a cheaper car , it does not matter as much .
#Text=Customize your car .
#Text=It does not have to be expensive .
#Text=Add action figures on the dashboard , quotes on your ceiling , or pictures of friends/family on the front of your glove box .
#Text=There are also some inexpensive things you can buy at most auto shops such as seat covers or fuzzy dice .
#Text=However , do n't decorate to distract you from driving .
#Text=Assuming it 's legal in your district , opt for a cheap manual custom spray job and/or neons .

#Text=Research first , on the internet or elsewhere , to make sure that your car is n't going to be dripping paint in the rain for a week or blow up when you switch on the neons and be sure to check with a legal professional or your local police station first .
#Text=Name your car .
#Text=Talk to him or her when he or she acts up or pulls through in the clutch .
#Text=Random names such as " Slippery Pete " are good as well as names that identify funny things about your car such as " Rusty " .
#Text=Even better , give the car a human name .
#Text=Go on a spontaneous road trip with your friends .
#Text=Memories will help you appreciate your car better .
#Text=Tips
#Text=The car will get flawed .
#Text=That is life , parts wear out and break down with age or heavy use .
#Text=But remember , the whole point cars are built is to be driven .
#Text=A detailing can make a stale car seem new .
#Text=Do n't worry about what others think of the car .
#Text=Chances are that they do n't know you and you 'll probably never see them again .
#Text=On top of that , most people do n't really care about your car 's appearance .
#Text=Clean your interior .
#Text=Wipe the dust off the dashboard , vacuum the floor mats , then hang up an air freshener .
#Text=This will make a surprisingly huge difference in your attitude towards your car .
#Text=Only think about the positive things about your car .
#Text=First kiss ?
#Text=The time the anti-lock brakes saved you from a serious collision ?
#Text=the iPod docking station to let you play your favourite songs on that special road trip ?
#Text=The heated leather seats ?
#Text=The sunroof ?
#Text=The crafty little-hidden storage compartments for hiding your sweets ?
#Text=If the car works and is in roadworthy condition , then that is what is most important .
